prop_dynamic.Name: targetname:-: :-:The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
prop_dynamic.Parent: parentname:-: :-:The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent.
prop_dynamic.Default Animation: DefaultAnim:-: :-:The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation.
prop_dynamic.Global Entity Name: globalname:-: :-:Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.
prop_dynamic.Damage Filter: damagefilter:-: :-:Name of the filter entity that controls which entities can damage us.

prop_dynamic.Skin: skin:-:0:-:Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.
prop_dynamic.Explosion Damage: ExplodeDamage:-:0:-:If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.
prop_dynamic.Explosion Radius: ExplodeRadius:-:0:-:If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.

prop_dynamic.Scale: modelscale:-:1.0:-:A multiplier for the size of the model.

prop_dynamic.FX Color: rendercolor:-:255 255 255:-:The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.

prop_dynamic.Randomly Animate: RandomAnimation:-:0:-:If set, this prop will randomly choose and play animations, based upon the times specified in 'Min/Max Random Anim Time'. Inbetween the random animations, it will revert to playing the 'Default Animation'.
prop_dynamic.Disable Bone Followers: DisableBoneFollowers:-:0:-:If set, this prop won't generate bone followers, even if they're listed in the model's .qc

prop_static.Lighting Origin: lightingorigin:-: :-:Select an info_lighting to specify a location to sample lighting from, instead of using this entity's origin.

prop_static.Skin: skin:-:0:-:Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.
prop_static.Start Fade Dist/Pixels: fademindist:-:-1:-:Distance at which the prop starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist). If 'Screen Space Fade' is selected, this represents the number of pixels wide covered by the prop when it starts to fade.
prop_static.End Fade Dist/Pixels: fademaxdist:-:0:-:Maximum distance at which the prop is visible (0 = don't fade out). If 'Screen Space Fade' is selected, this represents the *minimum* number of pixels wide covered by the prop when it fades.
prop_static.Fade Scale: fadescale:-:1:-:If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, or if the engine is running under dx7 [hl2/ep1/portal] or dx8 [ep2/tf], then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified. This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.

prop_dynamic_override.Name: targetname:-: :-:The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
prop_dynamic_override.Parent: parentname:-: :-:The name of this entity's parent in the movement hierarchy. Entities with parents move with their parent.
prop_dynamic_override.Default Animation: DefaultAnim:-: :-:The name of the idle animation that this prop will revert to whenever it finishes a random or forced animation.
prop_dynamic_override.Global Entity Name: globalname:-: :-:Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.
prop_dynamic_override.Damage Filter: damagefilter:-: :-:Name of the filter entity that controls which entities can damage us.

prop_dynamic_override.Skin: skin:-:0:-:Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.
prop_dynamic_override.Explosion Damage: ExplodeDamage:-:0:-:If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.
prop_dynamic_override.Explosion Radius: ExplodeRadius:-:0:-:If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.
prop_dynamic_override.Health: health:-:0:-:Number of points of damage to take before breaking. 0 means don't break.

prop_dynamic_override.Scale: modelscale:-:1.0:-:A multiplier for the size of the model.

prop_dynamic_override.FX Color: rendercolor:-:255 255 255:-:The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.

prop_dynamic_override.Randomly Animate: RandomAnimation:-:0:-:If set, this prop will randomly choose and play animations, based upon the times specified in 'Min/Max Random Anim Time'. Inbetween the random animations, it will revert to playing the 'Default Animation'.
prop_dynamic_override.Disable Bone Followers: DisableBoneFollowers:-:0:-:If set, this prop won't generate bone followers, even if they're listed in the model's .qc

prop_physics.Name: targetname:-: :-:The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
prop_physics.Global Entity Name: globalname:-: :-:Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.
prop_physics.Damage Filter: damagefilter:-: :-:Name of the filter entity that controls which entities can damage us.
prop_physics.Override Parameters: overridescript:-: :-:A list of physics key/value pairs that are usually in a physics prop .qc file. Format is 'key,value,key,value,etc'.
prop_physics.Break Model Message: BreakModelMessage:-: :-:If set, will use this break model message instead of the normal break behavior.

prop_physics.Skin: skin:-:0:-:Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.
prop_physics.Explosion Damage: ExplodeDamage:-:0:-:If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.
prop_physics.Explosion Radius: ExplodeRadius:-:0:-:If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.
prop_physics.Pressure Delay: pressuredelay:-:0:-:Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart).
prop_physics.Start Fade Dist/Pixels: fademindist:-:-1:-:Distance at which the prop starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist). If 'Screen Space Fade' is selected, this represents the number of pixels wide covered by the prop when it starts to fade.
prop_physics.End Fade Dist/Pixels: fademaxdist:-:0:-:Maximum distance at which the prop is visible (0 = don't fade out). If 'Screen Space Fade' is selected, this represents the *minimum* number of pixels wide covered by the prop when it fades.
prop_physics.Fade Scale: fadescale:-:1:-:If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, or if the engine is running under dx7 [hl2/ep1/portal] or dx8 [ep2/tf], then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified. This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.
prop_physics.Min Damage to Hurt: minhealthdmg:-:0:-:The prop will ignore any damage events if the damage is less than this amount.
prop_physics.Shadow Cast Distance: shadowcastdist:-:0:-:Use this to override how far this object casts shadows. 0 = default distance.
prop_physics.Health Level to Override Motion: damagetoenablemotion:-:0:-:If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Once its health has dropped below this specified amount, it will enable motion.
prop_physics.Physics Impact Force to Override Motion: forcetoenablemotion:-:0:-:If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Any impact that imparts a force greater than this value will enable motion.
prop_physics.FX Amount (0-255): renderamt:-:255:-:The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode.

prop_physics.Model Scale: modelscale:-:1.0:-:A multiplier for the size of the model.
prop_physics.Physics Impact Damage Scale: physdamagescale:-:0.1:-:Scales damage energy when this object is hit by a physics object. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility. Set to 1.0 for materials as strong as flesh, smaller numbers indicate stronger materials.
prop_physics.Scale Factor For Interia: inertiaScale:-:1.0:-:Scales the angular mass of an object. Used to hack angular damage and collision response.
prop_physics.Mass Scale: massScale:-:0.0:-:A scale multiplier for the object's mass.

prop_physics.FX Color: rendercolor:-:255 255 255:-:The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.

prop_physics.Dmaging it Doesn't Push it: nodamageforces:-:0:-:Used to determine whether or not damage should cause the entity to move.

light_spot.Name: targetname:-: :-:The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
light_spot.Custom Appearance: pattern:-: :-:A string of characters, like a sequence of piano keys, that define a pattern of brightness. a is dark and z is full intensity. Applies only to lights with a targetname.
light_spot.Entity to point at: target:-: :-:The name of an entity in the map that the spotlight will point at. This will override the spotlight's angles.

light_spot.BrightnessScaleHDR: _lightscaleHDR:-:1.0:-:Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.
light_spot.50 percent falloff distance: _fifty_percent_distance:-:0.0:-: Distance at which brightness should fall off to 50%. If set, overrides linear constant and quadratic paramaters.
light_spot.0 percent falloff distance: _zero_percent_distance:-:0.0:-: Distance at which brightness should fall off to negligible (1/256)%. Must set _fifty_percent_distance to use.
light_spot.Inner (bright) angle: _inner_cone:-:30.0:-: The angles of the inner spotlight beam. Value larger than 90 is interpreted as 90.
light_spot.Outer (fading) angle: _cone:-:45.0:-: The angles of the outer spotlight beam. Value larger than 90 is interpreted as 90.
light_spot.Focus: _exponent:-:1.0:-: Changes the distance between the umbra and penumbra cone. Higher values make the edge of the light more blurred. When increasing the Focus value to for example 5 you can use the spotlight as a directional fill light.
light_spot.Maximum distance: _distance:-:0:-: Changes the distance between the umbra and penumbra cone. Higher values make the edge of the light more blurred. When increasing the Focus value to for example 5 you can use the spotlight as a directional fill light.

light_spot.Brightness: _light:-:255 255 255:-:The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.
light_spot.BrightnessHDR: _lightHDR:-:-255 -255 -255:-:The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.

light_spot.Hard falloff: _hardfalloff:-:1:-:Causes lights to fall to exactly zero beyond the 0% distance. May cause unrealistic lighting if not used carefully.
